catalograisonne: Bartsch 29; Hollstein 23; New Hollstein 19 copy a; Strauss 355

makers.displaydate: 1558–1617; born Mülbracht, Netherlands; died Haarlem, Netherlands
makers.displaymaker: copy after Hendrick Goltzius, 1558–1617; born Mülbracht, Netherlands; died Haarlem, Netherlands

texts.textentryhtml: During his lifetime, Goltzius became celebrated throughout Europe as an extraordinary imitative painter, draftsman, and printmaker, who could observe, copy, and then surpass the works of earlier masters, including Dürer. Goltzius’s Passion series of 1596–98 includes several episodes, Betrayal of Christ among them, which clearly derive inspiration from the composition and clarity of the earlier artist’s engraved versions. In this theatrical interpretation, Goltzius extended the landscape in the background and amplified the nocturnal effect by adding twinkling stars to the sky as well as a large lantern held directly over Christ’s head.

bibliography.boilertext: Walter L. Strauss, ed., Hendrik Goltzius, 1558-1617: the complete engravings and woodcuts (New York: Abaris Books, 1977-).
